New Records: Aaron Judge hit his 52nd home run, leading the league in home runs
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge hit a go-ahead grand slam in the seventh inning
Luke Weaver got ready to pitch if the Yankees tied the game or took the lead
Weaver struck out the side in the eighth and got a six-out save in the ninth
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees did not panic despite Judge's 16-game home run drought
Boone believed it was only a matter of time before Judge broke out of his slump
Post-Match Reflections: Boone said Judge is as good as he's ever seen at dealing with the ups and downs of the season
Boone was comfortable with Weaver in any situation
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees are now three games up on the Orioles in the American League East, their largest division lead since June 14
Judge's slam gave him 130 RBIs, one shy of his career high of 131 set during his 2022 AL MVP campaign
